title: Nami heal bug
body: So I haven't done a ton of research into the matter but I was just in an Aram as nami. When i targeted a team member with nami's heal, it did drastically less healing than it says its supposed to. No matter the situation, I dry cast it on my 100ish health sivir outside of a fight, making sure she wasnt struck with the weakened healing debuff and it still came out the same. However, if i cast it on a team memeber and it bounced to an enemy and then back to another team mate it did the full amount on the returned heal but not the initial. Or if i just dry cast it on an enemy and had it bounce back it healed for the proper amount. I havent played nami in 5s for some time, im about to go do it to test if its the same there, or if its just in Arams. regardless I think this is a bug, not a major one but a bug none the less.

replies.body:
Healing others in ARAM is reduced by 50%.

Try playing Sona. Her rank 1 W heals for 15 and costs 80 mana.
Yup! Healing is reduced in ARAM. :]
with that said, as new soraka is design only to heal ally, did you guys ever though of disable her from aram? (she is more like a dead weight now)
Yeah, Soraka's in a really sad state. She looses all her health trying to keep teammates alive and can't even do that :(
Why the smiley face? 50% allied healing reduction sucks, especially after those health regen changes.
All non-self healing in aram is reduced by 50%

Ah ok, well, regardless of how stupid i am without doing any research, ive realized the second heal from the bounce isnt recieving the reduced healing. its doing the full amount. so technically its still a bug! right?

Try this: Start a heal on yourself. See if it does the full healing to both you and the second target. Then start the heal on someone else so that both heals hit someone else. I'm guessing they'll either both be reduced, or only the first will be reduced. Then start the heal on someone else so that the second heal hits you. I'm guessing it'll heal you both for the reduced amount.

Edit: I'm working off the hunch that the healing reduction is only applied if the initial target is not herself. If it is herself then it would do the full healing to everyone.
